direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods handle string manipulation involving escape characters with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods process CSS identifiers but perform different operations (escaping vs. consuming).
Both methods process CSS-related identifiers but for different purposes (escaping vs. consuming element selectors).
Both methods handle escaped CSS identifiers, making test cases for one method applicable to the other.
Both methods manipulate strings with balanced characters, though for different purposes.

Consuming a CSS identifier is a prerequisite for escaping it, ensuring the queue is in the correct state.
Both methods handle CSS identifiers and can be used to verify the correctness of the escaped output.
